body:
Does that JS file that's failing to load exist or not?

This is presumably a result of filenames changing when your site is redeployed. The experience there to users should be improved by #3412, but I don't know that you're going to be able to avoid Sentry complaining about it.

I'm also increasingly of the opinion that using something like Sentry to report all uncaught browser exceptions is basically useless as a way to find out when things are going wrong, because of the number of badly behaved browser extensions and network issues and so on that will report tons of errors that don't actually indicate that anything is wrong and that you can't do anything about.

> Does that JS file that's failing to load exist or not?
> 
> This is presumably a result of filenames changing when your site is redeployed. The experience there to users should be improved by #3412, but I don't know that you're going to be able to avoid Sentry complaining about it.
> 
> I'm also increasingly of the opinion that using something like Sentry to report all uncaught browser exceptions is basically useless as a way to find out when things are going wrong, because of the number of badly behaved browser extensions and network issues and so on that will report tons of errors that don't actually indicate that anything is wrong and that you can't do anything about.

~90% of the time the file exists, but when it fails it's not there of course. When it fails and the page is reloaded the missing index suddenly appears. I agree with not relying on Sentry to capture all uncaught errors, but this particular error has been quite high relative to the amount of traffic we are getting.

This sounds like the redeploy problem Conduitry outlined then. You could try to see if the error spikes after redeploys (according to #3412 by default the first minute after a redeploy is the "danger zone") to check if that's indeed the problem.
try to put a` .` before the slash` /` . It was working for me but the problem is how to perform this programmatically!

> try to put a` .` before the slash` /` . It was working for me but the problem is how to perform this programmatically!

where should I do this?

I'm also suddenly getting very similar errors and while my build is not failing the deployed website isn't working.

Edit: everything is working fine locally. Going back to previously deployed (and working) commits is however not working anymore. I'm using the netlify-adapter btw. Looks to me like maybe netlify has changed something.

I'm also now hitting something very similar as well on Netlify. Occurred for me when I upgraded Kit from 272 to 278. Rolling back to previous deploy **has** got my site back up so not quite the same experience as @el-schneider but this all sounds very similar.

The error at runtime in my case is...

```JSON
{
    "errorType": "Error",
    "errorMessage": "Dynamic require of \"buffer\" is not supported",
    "trace": [
        "Error: Dynamic require of \"buffer\" is not supported",
        "    at __require (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:28:9)",
        "    at node_modules/safe-buffer/index.js (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:5730:18)",
        "    at __require2 (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:34:44)",
        "    at node_modules/jws/lib/sign-stream.js (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:6261:19)",
        "    at __require2 (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:34:44)",
        "    at node_modules/jws/index.js (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:6441:22)",
        "    at __require2 (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:34:44)",
        "    at node_modules/jsonwebtoken/decode.js (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:6474:15)",
        "    at __require2 (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:34:44)",
        "    at node_modules/jsonwebtoken/index.js (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:8531:15)"
    ]
}
```

To follow up on how I solved my problem, in case it helps…

I removed…

```toml 
[functions]
    node_bundler = "esbuild"
```

…which I had added a while back to resolve some other problem building on Netlify. With that gone everything builds fine for me again now (including with latest version of kit). Until next time I guess.

> To follow up on how I solved my problem, in case it helps…
> 
> I removed…
> 
> ```toml
> [functions]
>     node_bundler = "esbuild"
> ```
> 
> …which I had added a while back to resolve some other problem building on Netlify. With that gone everything builds fine for me again now (including with latest version of kit). Until next time I guess.

NIce one! I had done the same and removing it fixed it for me too!

issue.title: [docs] remove mention of esbuild from Netlify docs
issue.body: I wasn't aware this was here. I've always advised against using `esbuild` because it adds another layer of complexity. Users are reporting their builds don't work if they use `esbuild` (https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/3978#issuecomment-1046307164), so we should remove this

issue.title: Netlify briefly broke esbuild builds, causing "Dynamic require of "X"" errors for every serverless rendered page [fixed]
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

as part of regular maintenance for swyxkit i [upgraded the deps](https://github.com/sw-yx/swyxkit/commit/98dd9f41af1a5d1b8652dfd62641e4ee644dd4fc) as per the title

and now [everything is throwing a 500 error](https://621638d27781070008fb992c--swyxkit.netlify.app/blog) with this `Dynamic require of "fs"` error, even though i'm pretty darn sure I don't actually write that code. EDIT: Possible related error: https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/2400

this error only happens in prod build, not in local dev. is this something broken in the netlify adapter?

```
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60 ERROR  Error: Dynamic require of "fs" is not supported
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60     at __require (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:28:9)
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60     at node_modules/gray-matter/index.js (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:10725:14)
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60     at __require2 (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:34:44)
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60     at .netlify/server/chunks/content-4d53413a.js (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:17141:37)
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60     at __init (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:31:50)
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60     at .netlify/server/entries/endpoints/api/listContent.json.js (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:17185:5)
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60     at __init (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:31:50)
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60     at file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:26540:51
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60     at async resolve (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:26295:83)
Feb 23, 07:43:09 PM: 24d25a60     at async respond (file:///var/task/.netlify/functions-internal/render.js:26246:22)
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6764957/155331234-fa543590-301d-4e0b-b1e4-23a01d5fa081.png)


### Reproduction

this is the netlify build logs https://app.netlify.com/sites/swyxkit/deploys/621638d27781070008fb992c

and this is the commit https://github.com/sw-yx/swyxkit/tree/c452df95219f73c4c3cd199490752656f0ab89ec



### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: macOS 11.3.1
    CPU: (8) x64 Apple M1
    Memory: 38.87 MB / 8.00 GB
    Shell: 5.8 - /bin/zsh
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.11.1 - /var/folders/h_/1lq46tdj7jdbs0j1m5l6rlb00000gn/T/fnm_multishell_23513_1645623105494/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.10 - /usr/local/bin/yarn
    npm: 8.0.0 - /var/folders/h_/1lq46tdj7jdbs0j1m5l6rlb00000gn/T/fnm_multishell_23513_1645623105494/bin/npm
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 98.0.4758.102
    Firefox: 94.0.2
    Safari: 14.1
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-netlify: ^1.0.0-next.46 => 1.0.0-next.46 
    @sveltejs/kit: ^1.0.0-next.283 => 1.0.0-next.283 
    svelte: ^3.44.3 => 3.46.4
```


### Severity

blocking an upgrade

### Additional Information

still trying to narrow down the precise version where this broke

issue.title: prevent unhandled rejections when loading page modules
issue.body:
fixes #3978. Even though the failure to load modules following a redeploy (which causes some filenames to be changed) was being dealt with (by causing the page to reload), rejections weren't being handled immediately before, when we preload modules to avoid waterfall.

This is a tricky thing to add a test for, but I verified that with this change the `unhandledrejection` event no longer happens, which should clean up Sentry logs etc.

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpx changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0

body: @knajjars How did you solve this problem?
I am also constantly seeing this error in Sentry, for both of my SvelteKit projects. It's quite annoying, and I am not sure what to do about this.
